intro: Stylidium milleri, commonly known as the Miller's triggerplant, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive trigger mechanism that aids in pollination by releasing pollen when touched. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a unique structure that facilitates mechanical pollination. Stylidium milleri is a member of the family Haemodoraceae, known for its specialized floral adaptations.
